canonical_inventory.name: 6-Layer Data Governance Architecture Model
canonical_inventory.full_context: A reference model representing data governance through two lenses: technical and business. It consists of 6 layers: Data Governance Oversight, Data Governance Policy, Data Governance Operating Model, Data Governance Metadata Management, Data Governance Functional Capabilities, and Business Operating Platforms.
canonical_inventory.description: The high-level architectural framework for data governance at scale.

sources.file_name: 189988865-Practical Data- Reference Architecture for Data Governance at Scale.xhtml

conflicts.conflicting_source: 189988865-Practical Data- Reference Architecture for Data Governance at Scale.xhtml
conflicts.conflict_description: The summary table assigns 'Data Governance Operating Model' to Layer 4 and 'Data Governance Metadata Management' to Layer 2. However, the headers in the text describe 'Layer 3 - Data Governance Metadata Management' and 'Layer 3: Operating Model', creating a numbering conflict.

canonical_inventory.name: Data Management Portal
canonical_inventory.full_context: A unified interface that enables all business users to interact with the data governance suite of capabilities based on their specific data governance role. It interacts with the metadata repository (read) and orchestration capability (create/update/delete).
canonical_inventory.description: The end-user experience layer for data governance.

sources.file_name: 189988865-Practical Data- Reference Architecture for Data Governance at Scale.xhtml

canonical_inventory.name: Orchestration Capability
canonical_inventory.full_context: The framework enabling policy- and rules-driven metadata management. It handles all CREATE/UPDATE/DELETE operations for metadata, responsible for conflict resolution, audit trails, and change management. It prevents direct unchecked writes to the repository.
canonical_inventory.description: Centralized control for all metadata mutations.

sources.file_name: 189988865-Practical Data- Reference Architecture for Data Governance at Scale.xhtml

canonical_inventory.name: Metadata Repository
canonical_inventory.full_context: A centralized management store responsible for maintaining all data governance metadata. It provides version control, rollback, change management, and auditing through API services. It is the single location for storing the Data Governance Metadata Model.
canonical_inventory.description: The central storage engine for all governance data.

sources.file_name: 189988865-Practical Data- Reference Architecture for Data Governance at Scale.xhtml
205422624-Practical Data- Data Governance At Scale - Data Governance Metadata Repository & Data Model.xhtml

canonical_inventory.name: Information Set
canonical_inventory.full_context: A term used to describe related information about an object stored in the metadata repository based on the information's purpose and often aligned to the capability. Some capabilities have multiple Information Sets.
canonical_inventory.description: Logical grouping of attributes related to a specific purpose.

sources.file_name: 205422624-Practical Data- Data Governance At Scale - Data Governance Metadata Repository & Data Model.xhtml

canonical_inventory.name: Technical Inventory Hierarchy
canonical_inventory.full_context: A five-level hierarchy to describe high-level technology structure: 1. APPLICATION (System), 2. COMPONENT (Sub-component/Database), 3. SCHEMA (Logical subdivision), 4. CONTAINER (Table/File), 5. ATTRIBUTE (Column/Field).
canonical_inventory.description: Standard hierarchy for organizing technical data assets.

sources.file_name: 205422624-Practical Data- Data Governance At Scale - Data Governance Metadata Repository & Data Model.xhtml

canonical_inventory.name: Attribute
canonical_inventory.full_context: The lowest level of a technical hierarchy, representing the point at which data values are stored and managed (e.g., LastName). It is Mandatory in the hierarchy.
canonical_inventory.description: The atomic unit of data management.

sources.file_name: 205422624-Practical Data- Data Governance At Scale - Data Governance Metadata Repository & Data Model.xhtml

canonical_inventory.name: Data Lineage
canonical_inventory.full_context: A capability to capture system specifications of data and how it flows between systems. It uses 'Detectors' for ingestion and 'Enrichers' to add business context. It manages CREATE/UPDATE/DELETE operations for Lineage data via orchestration.
canonical_inventory.description: Tracking the flow and transformation of data across systems.

sources.file_name: 189988865-Practical Data- Reference Architecture for Data Governance at Scale.xhtml
205422624-Practical Data- Data Governance At Scale - Data Governance Metadata Repository & Data Model.xhtml

canonical_inventory.name: Data Quality
canonical_inventory.full_context: Evaluates current data quality against requirements. It reads from Inventory and Rules, executes tests, and manages Data Quality Issues as work items via orchestration.
canonical_inventory.description: Assessment and monitoring of data accuracy and completeness.

sources.file_name: 189988865-Practical Data- Reference Architecture for Data Governance at Scale.xhtml
205422624-Practical Data- Data Governance At Scale - Data Governance Metadata Repository & Data Model.xhtml

summary.notes: Two source files were test pages containing Lorem Ipsum and yielded no items. Document 1 contains significant numbering inconsistencies regarding the layer model.

issues_found: Document 1 has internal consistency issues with Layer numbering (Table vs Headers).
